titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 1892) to amend title 4, United States Code, to provide for the flying of the flag at half-staff in the event of the death of a first responder in the line of duty.

Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 1892) to amend title 4, United States Code, to provide for the flying of the flag at half-staff in the event of the death of a first responder in the line of duty.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-551, by Mr. Sessions.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 125.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 734.

Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 1892. The motion shall be debatable for one hour and the previous question shall be considered as ordered on the motion to adoption without intervening motion.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 186 (Roll no. 67).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 193 (Roll no. 68).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 1892) to amend title 4, United States Code, to provide for the flying of the flag at half-staff in the event of the death of a first responder in the line of duty.
